instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Are you using original 85W Magsafe charger?
Post <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.34v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.33V
"Are you using original 85W Magsafe charger? '' yes, original.
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>  3.30v.


Mac accepts PRAM reset, but has no image, cooler rotates normally.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Is it the classic GPU fault?

Mac reads the external SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Looks like you have dificulties to explain the symptomps of your boards.
You tittled "no power" and said  missing <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
Now the fan spins, machine is on, has even USB activity.
How can we help, if you do not provide accurate information???

Hardware mode to disable GPU on this board, has already been posted on the forum.
Just in case, resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> first...
